claim rewards by providing a signature from the authorized signer Flow: 1. User earns rewards in off-chain battle system 2. Server generates signature for user's total earned amount 3. User calls claim() with signature (pays gas) 4. Contract verifies signature and transfers claimable amount Security: - Signature-based claim (prevents unauthorized claims) - Nonce system (prevents replay attacks) - Incremental claiming (tracks total claimed per user) - EIP-712 typed data signing (prevents signature reuse across contracts)","errors":{"AddressEmptyCode(address)":[{"details":"There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract)."}],"AddressInsufficientBalance(address)":[{"details":"The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignature()":[{"details":"The signature derives the `address(0)`."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256)":[{"details":"The signature has an invalid length."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32)":[{"details":"The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order."}],"FailedInnerCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. claim(uint256,uint256,bytes).details: User pays gas for this transactionOnly claims the difference between totalEarned and already claimed

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

CLAIM_TYPEHASH().notice: Claim message type hash for EIP-712

getClaimableAmount(address,uint256).notice: Get claimable amount for a user
